div.span: Coronavirus Related Updates from Salida Schools

span.style: font-size: 28px; line-height: 107%; font-family: Arial; color: black;

strong.span: Actualizaciones relacionadas con el virus Corona de las escuelas de Salida

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span:
The Salida School District is currently serving students through a digital platform in order to protect our students, families, staff and community from the COVID-19 pandemic. Stay home, stay safe.
Chaffee County Public Health will be giving out free reusable masks on Wednesday from 3-4:30 at the Touber Building, C Street Parking Lot. Masks are free, donations accepted, and a limit of 3 per car.
Click here for current information on our response to the pandemic.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span:
El Distrito Escolar de Salida actualmente está sirviendo a los estudiantes a través de una plataforma digital para proteger a nuestros estudiantes, familias, personal y comunidad de la pandemia de COVID-19. Quédate en casa, mantente a salvo.
Chaffee County Public Health entregará máscaras reutilizables gratuitas el miércoles de 3 a 4:30 en el edificio Touber, estacionamiento de la calle C. Las máscaras son gratuitas, se aceptan donaciones y un límite de 3 por automóvil.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: Haga clic aquí para obtener información actualizada sobre nuestra respuesta a la pandemia.

span.style: font-family: Tahoma; font-size: 13px;

a.title: Read More About Coronavirus Related Updates from Salida Schools

div.h2: Welcome to the Salida School District

div.p:
Salida Schools wants to welcome you to a new school year and a brand new web space for the community. We are replacing our old website with a new website and communication platform that will bring our schools, students and teachers to forefront of the 21st century.
​Salida Schools is a fun team to be part of. The district has seen consistent numerous awards for the last five years, including being named a District of Distinction since 2013. The Salida Chamber of Commerce named the district the Business of Year. However, the real fun goes beyond accolades and honors. The district is striving to not only be a community school, but also ensure every individual student is growing. Success is about individual kids each year. Success is different for each kid as well.
The community is small enough to know and address each student as an individual, and the community has enough synergy to ensure that every student gets the support needed. Last year the local community gave over $65,000 in scholarships to students. No district in the state has had more Boettcher scholars in the last 6 years than Salida. Yet, college is not for all. The district committed to new graduation guidelines, requiring every student to complete a capstone project that applies learning in the real world. The district started a building trades program, building houses by students for staff. That same philosophy of success for each and every kid requires that teachers know their students personally and adapt to those student's learning style and needs. That approach is seen all the way down to the Early Childhood Center.
Salida Schools is not a perfect team, but it is a lot of fun being part of a community that strives to support each individual kiddo. If you ever have questions or needs, please contact a teacher, an administrator, or myself--we want to hear from our community.
David Blackburn
Salida School District
Superintendent

span.style: font-size: 18pt; background: white none repeat scroll 0% 0%; font-family: "Arial", "sans-serif"; color: firebrick;
font-size: 18pt; background: white none repeat scroll 0% 0%; font-family: "Arial", "sans-serif"; color: firebrick;
font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; text-align: start; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; word-spacing: 0px;

p.span: Salida School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, creed, age, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information, disability or other status protected by law in admission or access to, treatment and employment in its programs and activities. The following person(s) have been identified as the compliance officers for the District to handle inquiries regarding the nondiscrimination policies:

Questions, complaints or requests for additional information regarding these laws or issues concerning discrimination (including information about how to file a grievance if you believe you are the victim of discrimination) should be directed to the compliance officer for these issues.
​Grievance Procedure - Regulation
Grievance Form

span.style: font-size: 10pt; background: white none repeat scroll 0% 0%; font-family: "Arial", "sans-serif"; color: black;
font-size: 10pt; background: white none repeat scroll 0% 0%; font-family: "Arial", "sans-serif"; color: rgb(74, 68, 68);

p.span: Specific complaints of alleged discrimination based on disability should be referred to the Director of Academic Affairs.

div.div: Grow Dome Open House at the Community & School Farm Check out the new geodesic dome greenhouse. Tour the farm to see what we're growing for the school cafeterias. Taste fresh produce and enjoy mingling outdoors. Share community education topics you'd be excited to learn about. Find out how to get involved! Thursday, September 12th, 4-6 pm 1455 Holman Ave, Salida (next to the dog park) All are welcome! ...
